intro: Nauchea bracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or bracteate nauchea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Nauchea bracteata is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
